feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 5 stages: D, R, I, V, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission describes and demonstrates a working financial application: it defines inputs/outputs, executes scenarios that produce concrete present- and future-value numbers, and reflects on those results. The Discover and Implement stages show the tool was built and used; the Reflect stage shows conceptual understanding of the financial outputs, meeting PASS criteria.
- Integrate AI: The student explicitly used AI to build a user-input financial workflow and demonstrated its outputs across multiple scenarios with concrete numbers, showing that AI integration added analytic value. The combination of discovery, hands-on implementation, and reflection indicates a thorough, effective integration of AI.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "So I said create the simplest possible app where a user inputs the money they invest every year, their level of risk, the time period in years, and assumes an inflation rate of 2%, where the workflow outputs the present value of their money."
"we'll go in here and we'll put the risk level on high. and we'll send it and we can see our future value will be $35 .57, $1,007 made in that five years and our present value will be $32.22"
"Now we can see that their present value is $1,365,354, a massive amount of money, and their future value is over $2,240,000, almost eight times the amount of money that they originally invested."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover — student defines goal to build a simple financial app analyzing present/future value; Implement — student runs scenarios in the app and reports numeric outputs; Reflect — student interprets results and risk implications.
criteria.reasoning: The submission describes and demonstrates a working financial application: it defines inputs/outputs, executes scenarios that produce concrete present- and future-value numbers, and reflects on those results. The Discover and Implement stages show the tool was built and used; the Reflect stage shows conceptual understanding of the financial outputs, meeting PASS criteria.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "So I said to the AI that I wanted to create the simplest possible financial workflow that analyzes present value of money based on your level of risk you take on when investing."
"So, we'll go in here and we'll put the risk level on high. and we'll send it and we can see our future value will be $35 .57, $1,007 made in that five years and our present value will be $32.22"

"So I said create the simplest possible app where a user inputs the money they invest every year, their level of risk, the time period in years, and assumes an inflation rate of 2%, where the workflow outputs the present value of their money."
criteria.driver_alignment: DISCOVER — student identified an AI use-case (analyze present/future value by risk). IMPLEMENT — student used the AI-created workflow to run multiple scenarios and obtain numeric PV/FV outputs. REFLECT — student interpreted results and discussed volatility and implications.
criteria.reasoning: The student explicitly used AI to build a user-input financial workflow and demonstrated its outputs across multiple scenarios with concrete numbers, showing that AI integration added analytic value. The combination of discovery, hands-on implementation, and reflection indicates a thorough, effective integration of AI.
